After detecting a predetermined amount of rainfall, this sensor pauses scheduled watering, preventing unwanted water loss._x000D_
Watering the site during a downpour leads not only to oversaturation of plants and turf with moisture, but also to overspending water._x000D_
Mini Clik rain sensor from Hunter offers the most simple and effective way to prevent sprinklers from turning on during a downpour or after a set amount of precipitation has fallen. It easily connects to any automatic irrigation system._x000D_
The Mini-Clik sensor stops scheduled watering when it detects a pre-set amount of rainfall. This automatic process makes it possible to guarantee that areas will not be watered during a downpour. After a downpour, the Mini-Clik sensor allows the controller to resume watering in normal mode._x000D_
Mini-Clik is compatible with all Hunter controllers, and once connected, it is guaranteed to block the operation of the installed system during rain._x000D_

Presto-PS Rain Sensor for Controllers and Timers irrigation_x000D_
Rain sensor Presto-PS (7806) is used in combination with electronic timers and controllers and allows you to automatically turn off the water supply in case of precipitation. The sensor reacts to precipitation and turns off the water supply for irrigation._x000D_
In the upper part of the case there are holes for catching raindrops, which wet special discs that swell from moisture and press the button with a rod. The button opens the circuit and the timer does not include the watering program._x000D_
When the discs are dry, they are compressed, the button is released and the watering timer continues to perform its functions._x000D_
The sensor is connected to the watering timer with a 7-meter cable. There is a jack plug at the end of the cable. The sensor is suitable for watering timers that have a suitable socket. Timers and controllers without such a socket can be connected by removing the plug and connecting the wires directly to the contacts for connecting the sensor._x000D_
Advantages_x000D_
The sensor can be programmed to trigger with an average amount of precipitation of 3 mm., 6 mm., 12 mm., 19 mm. and 25 mm._x000D_
Universal mounting bracket with quick clamp_x000D_
No additional maintenance required_x000D_
Cable length 7m._x000D_
Return time on weekend state: about 4 hours in dry sunny weather_x000D_
Time to return to original state from high humidity state: about 3 days in dry sunny weather_x000D_
The frost sensor stops the system when the temperature drops to +3ºС_x000D_
Rain sensor components_x000D_
Test rod – press to manually test the rain sensor. When the stem is pressed, the sensor should stop watering._x000D_
Regulator cover for setting the activation threshold depending on the amount of precipitation. The sensor can be programmed to trigger when the average amount of precipitation is 3 mm, 6 mm, 12 mm, 19 mm. and 25 mm._x000D_
 Universal quick-clamp mounting bracket - makes it easy to install on gutter, side of roof, etc._x000D_

Hunter WR-Click Wireless Rain Sensor_x000D_
Hunter WR-Click wireless rain sensor model is completely autonomous thanks to the use of a battery of increased capacity (working life is 10 years). This device is fully compatible with most existing electronic control units. The undoubted advantage of the kit is the complete absence of wires for connecting the sensors, that is, there is no need to lay them or dig trenches for their installation._x000D_
To prevent unwanted water losses, the built-in Quick Response™ technology instantly turns off watering immediately after the start of rain._x000D_
Most devices designed to detect rain first accumulate a set amount of precipitation, and only after that a switch is triggered that disconnects the circuit from the controller and disables the system. During this "accumulation period", the system continues to waste water. This can be particularly disadvantageous for municipalities, businesses and residential property owners for whom cost savings is key._x000D_
Using built-in Quick Response technology, Hunter's wired and wireless Rain-Clik sensors can provide to the controller, the shutdown command immediately after the start of rain._x000D_
Principle of operation_x000D_
When water hits the sensor, the cork tree placed inside swells, which causes the contact to open, i.e. the signal is sent to the controller. Further, the control unit, having processed the information, shuts off the water or prevents its further supply during rain._x000D_
The contact is closed when the plug dries - approximately 4 hours in sunny and warm weather. It takes up to 3 days for complete soaking (heavy and constant rainfall)._x000D_
Important! In the event of frost, the Hunter WR-Click Wireless Rain Sensor (Frost Sensor) automatically turns off the automatic irrigation system._x000D_
Using built-in Quick Response technology, Hunter's wired and wireless Rain-Clik sensors can provide the controller will send the shutdown command immediately after the start of rain._x000D_
Rain-Clik can be installed on an eaves or any flat vertical surface (for example, on a wall or fences). A special mount is also offered, which allows you to easily mount the sensor on the edge of the gutter._x000D_

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter Solar Sync-Sen high-tech weather sensor calculates evapotranspiration (ET) indicator_x000D_
Solar Sync is a sensor system that involves connecting to the compatibility of the Hunter controller automatically adjusts the occurrence of the irrigation controller taking into account changes in the climate of climatic conditions. In the Solar Sync system, sensors of increased density and temperature are used to determine evapotranspiration (ET) indicators on the territory of the site, as well as the speed at which plants and turf use the applied load. In addition, Solar Sync includes Hunter's Rain-Clik® Rain and Freeze-Clik® Freeze Sensors, which shut off your irrigation system during rain and/or freezing weather._x000D_
Ultimately, a new efficient irrigation system is produced that will save water and improve the condition of the plants on the site. Program the controller as usual and Solar Sync goes all out, with manual watering schedule adjustments possible._x000D_
The Solar Sync system can be easily installed on any supported Hunter device controller (see owner's manual or owner's manual controller to see if it is compatible with Solar Sync). The system consists of a sensor and a receiver. The receiver is required only in the assembly with the wireless sensor. The sensor should be triggered when atmospheric emissions are triggered, in which the maximum amount of increased radiation is set. The receiver is installed next to or on top of the Hunter controller. The Solar Sync sensor measures the amount of light and temperature, and also calculates the daily evapotranspiration (ET) in order to provide the best quality irrigation._x000D_
This option is the amount of water that plants lose under the influence of local climatic factors, and which must be replenished with irrigation. The Solar Sync sensor also comes with a Hunter Rain-Clik sensor that automatically shuts off the irrigation system when it rains, preventing excessive water use. Enter the midsummer watering schedule on the controller according to the instructions in the Owner's Manual. Solar Sync receives data from the sensor and applies it to the controller's watering schedule, changing the programmed watering duration through the controller's seasonal adjustment feature._x000D_
Solar Sync System Components_x000D_
Rain-Clik sensor prevents watering from starting or continuing during rain. It requires no setup or calibration. Rain-Clik uses patented Quick Response® technology that shuts off the irrigation system within the first few minutes after it starts raining. The only element that needs to be adjusted is the ventilation ring, which allows you to slow down or speed up the drying process of the sensor and the time of reactivation of the irrigation system. Opening_x000D_
 vents accelerates drying of the sensor, closing them slows it down._x000D_
In addition, the built-in Solar Sync temperature sensor shuts down the system when frost is detected. At temperatures around 37°F (3°C) and below, Solar Sync signals the controller to stop watering. After the sensor is activated, the message "Sensor off" is displayed on the controller display. When the temperature rises above 37°F (3°C), automatic watering is turned back on._x000D_
Solar Sync Wireless System Components_x000D_
Into Solar Wireless System Design Sync includes a downward pointing antenna, which ensures communication with the receiver._x000D_
Solar Sync Wireless Receiver_x000D_
The Solar Sync receiver can be mounted on the wall next to the controller or in a cutout on the side parts controller._x000D_

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter Soil-Clik soil moisture sensor_x000D_
This sensor allows you to avoid water loss by measuring soil moisture and turning off watering when a preset level is reached._x000D_
Soil-Clik simplifies the procedure for determining soil moisture. The Soil-Clik sensitive element uses time-tested technology to measure moisture levels in the root zone of plants. When the sensitive element detects that the required level of soil moisture has been reached, the sensor turns off irrigation, preventing excessive water consumption._x000D_
Soil-Clik consists of two components - a sensitive element for determining the level of moisture placed in the soil and an electronic module , which exchanges data with the sensitive element and the controller. The sensitive element is installed very easily: it is enough to bury it in the soil at the depth of the root zone of the plant material. The sensor can be placed at a distance of 300 meters from the controller. Each press of the button allows you to adjust the required level of humidity and leads to an immediate update of the measured value._x000D_
The module can be connected to any AC powered Hunter controllers. In addition, it is compatible with most third-party AC-powered controllers. The Soil-Clik sensor can be programmed to shut off the irrigation system when sufficient moisture is reached._x000D_
Backed by Hunter's 5-year warranty, the Soil-Clik sensor is an effective water-saving solution when used alone or in combination with the Solar Sync® sensor, while allowing to implement the most ecological solution._x000D_

Selecting a location for the contact sensor_x000D_
The sensitive element is installed in the root zone to ensure proper control of soil moisture._x000D_
When used in turf, the sensor should be placed in the root zone at a depth of approximately 15 cm (depending on the condition turf)._x000D_
When using in an area with trees and shrubs, choose a deeper location according to the root zone. In the area with newly planted seedlings, place the sensor in the native soil at a depth of about half of the root ball._x000D_

Mini rain sensor is used in automatic irrigation systems. The device is designed for economical water consumption. The rain sensor reacts to precipitation. The mini rain sensor is connected by a cable to a special socket of the Aqualin timer. It is set to trigger when there is a certain amount of precipitation. The device increases the efficiency of automatic watering systems, minimizes water consumption without human intervention. Before the winter season, the mini rain sensor must be removed and stored in a dry place._x000D_

The K-Rain Rain/Freeze Sensor will turn your irrigation controller into a water-saving expert by effectively suspending watering during periods of rain and/or frost.  Once a certain amount of rainfall and/or freezing temperatures are reached (for models with a freeze sensor), the sensor will cause the controller to pause watering. After a certain amount of rain has fallen and/or subzero temperatures (for models with a freeze sensor), the sensor triggers the controller to stop watering._x000D_
The universal K-Rain rain sensor receiver allows you to connect a wireless sensor rain/freeze K-Rain to virtually any manufacturer's controller, providing a cost-effective option for adding a wireless rain sensor to most irrigation systems. Available as a kit containing the K-Rain Universal Rain Sensor Receiver and Wireless Rain/Freeze Sensor._x000D_
Unlike other rain sensors on the market, the K-Rain® Wireless Rain and Freeze Sensor (model 3208-WRFS) can be linked to multiple Wi-Fi-enabled K-Rain PRO EX 2.0 controllers within range, providing additional the value of the ultimate goal. User. Wired rain sensors work with closed-loop timers._x000D_

Universal rain sensor receiver_x000D_
Flexibility. Allows the K-Rain wireless rain/freeze sensor to be connected to a controller equipped with any manufacturer's rain sensor terminal._x000D_
Simplicity. Provides the advantage of extremely quick and easy installation and programming, as well as easy pairing with the K-Rain rain sensor._x000D_
Atmospheric resistance. Made of impact-resistant, UV-resistant polymer for outdoor use._x000D_
Maintenance-free. No replaceable batteries. Designed for use up to 8 years._x000D_

2-in-1 mounting. Provides flexible installation with standard flat and gutter mounting._x000D_

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter SOLAR SYNC KIT_x000D_
Solar Sync is a sensor system designed for use with compatible Hunter controllers to automatically adjust watering parameters based on changes in local weather conditions._x000D_
Complete_x000D_
The Solar Sync system uses solar radiation and temperature sensors to determine total evapotranspiration (ET) on the site and the rate at which plants and turf absorb moisture._x000D_
It also includes Rain-Clik™ and Freeze-Clik™ sensors that allow you to automatically turn off the irrigation system during rain and frost._x000D_
The sensor communicates with the controller with the help of a compact control module, which allows you to automatically increase or decrease the operation time of the irrigation system depending on changes in weather conditions._x000D_
As a result, you get a new efficient irrigation system that saves water and will improve the condition of the plants on the site. Program the controller as usual and Solar Sync will do the rest_x000D_
, eliminating the need to manually adjust the watering schedule._x000D_
Principle of work_x000D_
Solar Sync wireless system is easy and simple install on any compatible Hunter Irrigation Controller (see Owner's Manual for compatibility)._x000D_
Solar Sync wireless sensor measures solar radiation and temperature and calculates daily total evapotranspiration (ET) to adjust irrigation. The latter reflects the amount of moisture lost by plants under the influence of local climatic factors, which must be replenished with irrigation. The Solar Sync Wireless System also includes Rain-Clik™ and Freeze-Clik® sensors that allow you to automatically turn off the irrigation system in the event of rain or frost._x000D_
Set a midsummer watering schedule in the controller by following the programming instructions in your controller's manual. The Solar Sync sensor sends weather data to the control module, which adjusts the controller's watering schedule using the seasonal adjustment function._x000D_
This user guide applies to the following kits:WSS: Solar Sync Wireless Sensor Set for Hunter Pro-C, PCC, ICC and I-Core Controllers_x000D_
WSSSEN*: Solar Sync Wireless Sensor Set for Hunter ACC and X Controllers -Core_x000D_
* - Please note that the Solar Sync control module is not included in the WSSSEN kit. ACC and X-Core controllers have built-in Solar Sync software, eliminating the need for a separate control module. Therefore, the WSSSEN kit is intended for use with ACC and X-Core controllers only._x000D_
Name: Solar synchronization sensor Hunter Solar Sync Kit is wireless

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter Freeze-Clik to disable sprinklers for a period frost_x000D_
Use this sensor to turn off sprinklers during frost and ensure reliable protection of landscaping areas, walkways and driveways from icicles._x000D_
Unintentionally turning on the irrigation system during a significant freeze is one of the worst things that can happen to a landscape design area. In some regions with unpredictable temperature fluctuations, watering during frost is a danger not only to the specific object, but also to those who may pass or drive by it._x000D_
By connecting the Freeze-Clik sensor to the system from company Hunter, these experiences can be forgotten. When frost is detected, the Freeze-Clik sensor automatically turns off the irrigation system. When the temperature rises to an acceptable level for watering, the Freeze-Clik sensor activates the irrigation system according to the program._x000D_
The Freeze-Clik sensor is easy to install and easy to use. In addition, it can be used in conjunction with other weather-sensing devices to ensure efficient watering regardless of the vagaries of the weather._x000D_
Benefits_x000D_
Automatically shuts off the irrigation system when temperature drop below 3°C_x000D_
Easily connected to automatic irrigation systems without additional adjustment_x000D_
Used together with other sensors to increase the overall efficiency of the system irrigation_x000D_
Technical characteristics_x000D_
Switching current (~24 V): 5 A_x000D_
The delivery includes a two-wire insulated wire 7 m long with a cross section of 0.5 mm.sq., which meets the requirements of the UL standard_x000D_
Certificates: UL, CUL, FCC, CE, RCM_x000D_
Height: 5 see_x000D_
Length: 11 cm._x000D_
Width: 11 cm._x000D_
Name: Hunter Freeze Clik frost sensor

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter Flow-Clik will immediately stop the water supply in in case of pipeline rupture or leakage_x000D_
Undetected pipe break or faulty drain can bring a lot of trouble. Flowers and lawns may be flooded, slopes may begin to erode, and hundreds of liters of water will be wasted. The Flow Clik flow sensor is specially designed to prevent problems in case of pipeline damage._x000D_
The Flow-Clik can be programmed to a specific flow level. The sensor will stop irrigation if the set level is exceeded. This greatly reduces the risk of wasted water and system damage in the event of pipe leaks._x000D_
Standard kit for all ~24V powered controllers. Includes sensor and interface module, FCT tee required to install sensor in pipe._x000D_
Advantages_x000D_
Automatically stops watering when the set flow level in the pipeline is exceeded_x000D_
Protects against flooding and soil erosion in the event of a pipe burst_x000D_
Flexible setup provides precise control of the system: programming a specific flow level for the system with one button_x000D_
Compatible with most control panels from Hunter and other manufacturersColor LED indicator when the power is on displays the system status and shows whether the flow is normal_x000D_
Compatible with most industrial and private piping systems_x000D_
Technical characteristics_x000D_
Recommended pressure: 1.5-15.0 bar; 150-1500 kPa_x000D_
Current consumption (~24 V): 0.025 A_x000D_
Switching current: 2 A (max.)_x000D_
Sensor wiring: two-wire wire for laying directly in the soil with a cross-section of 0.75 mm.sq. or more, with color marking or indication of polarity, the distance to the interface module is no more than 300 m._x000D_
Programmed start delay: from 0 to 300 seconds (allows to stabilize the hydraulic parameters of the system and prevents false flow values)_x000D_
Programmed shutdown period_x000D_
Name: Hunter Flow-Clik flow sensor

Unnamed: 2:
Hunter SC-Probe Soil Moisture Sensor for Node -BT_x000D_
The new technology simplifies the measurement of soil moisture. Irrigation turns off when the desired moisture level is reached. The sensor uses a proven technology to measure moisture right in the root zone._x000D_
As soon as the sensor understands that the soil has the required moisture level, it will turn off irrigation, preventing water loss. The device consists of two components: a moisture sensor probe, it is placed in the soil, and an electronic module, it communicates with the probe and the controller._x000D_
Advantages_x000D_
Instant view of soil moisture level and system status_x000D_
One-touch shutdown function allows you to ignore indicator of soil moisture in special operating conditions_x000D_
Low-voltage model in a housing for outdoor installation with power from the main controller_x000D_
Possibility of connecting to the inputs for Hunter sensors or used to open conventional conductive lines in almost any which irrigation system with a supply voltage of ~24 V_x000D_
Used in conjunction with a Solar Sync™ sensor to ensure maximum water savings_x000D_
Operational characteristics_x000D_
Switching current (~24 V): 5 A_x000D_
Current consumption (~24 V): 100 mA_x000D_
Shutdown by means of a normally closed dry contact_x000D_
Maximum distance from the Soil-Clik module to the controller: 2m._x000D_
Maximum distance from the Soil-Clik module to the sensor element in AC power systems: 300 m._x000D_
Maximum distance in NODE-BT based systems: 30 m_x000D_
The sensitive element of the sensor is equipped with a wire 80 cm long, which is designed to be laid directly in the soil_x000D_
Certificates: UL, CUL, FCC, CE, RCM_x000D_
Installation_x000D_
The probe does not require special installation skills - you just need to bury it to the required root depth. It can be placed at a distance of 300 meters from the controller. Simple button operation allows you to adjust the desired humidity level with an immediate update of the actual measurements._x000D_
The module connects to all Hunter AC powered controllers and will work with AC powered controllers from many other manufacturers. The device can be programmed to turn off watering when it senses sufficient moisture._x000D_
Backed by Hunter's 5-year warranty, the sensor is an effective water-saving device either by itself or as an addition to an irrigation system for an environmentally friendly solution._x000D_
When using in turf, the sensor should be placed in the root zone at a depth of approximately 15 cm (depending on the condition turf)._x000D_
When using in an area with trees and shrubs, choose a deeper location according to the root zone. In the area with newly planted seedlings, place the sensor in the native soil at a depth of about half of the root ball._x000D_
Name: Hunter SC-Probe soil moisture sensor for Node-BT

Section: Automatic Watering Equipment / Weather Sensors / Hunter Weather Sensors
Unnamed: 2:
Hunter Wind-Clik sensor provides effective irrigation of areas and reliably protects footpaths._x000D_
This sensor ensures efficient watering of areas and reliably protects footpaths and driveways by turning off irrigation as speed increases wind._x000D_
Look at any rain performance chart and you will see that this data was collected during tests in complete absence of wind. Of course, in the real world, not all days will be windless. And although most sprinklers can provide close to the maximum efficiency of operation under a certain wind force, increasing the speed of movement of air flows on the object can significantly worsen the characteristics of water distribution. In addition, it can even cause financial liability if, under the influence of the wind, sprinklers begin to water pedestrian paths or roads along with cars passing by them._x000D_
Hunter's Wind-Clik sensor is the most effective solution for such situations. , as it shuts off the irrigation system during periods of high winds (with the possibility of setting thresholds for shut-off) and then automatically resumes operation when the weather conditions become more favorable._x000D_
With the Wind-Clik sensor, you will save your nerve cells and save water and money, because your system will only work when you can be absolutely sure that it is intended to be watered area of water will be used for its intended purpose._x000D_
To fully control the situation, use the extensive capabilities of Wind-Clik and you will no longer have to throw money away._x000D_

Disables watering in high winds_x000D_
Great for fountains except overflow in windy weather_x000D_
Easy to connect to automatic systems irrigation thanks to the possibility of quick adjustment_x000D_

Hunter SPNODE solar panel_x000D_
 The need to fully provide automated irrigation systems with electricity could not be closed . The proposed model of the Hunter SPNODE solar panel provides continuous recovery of the entire system in use by converting solar energy into electricity._x000D_
 Attention! Fasteners for the panel are included in its initial set, which makes it possible to immediately install the solar battery. It is recommended to perform the installation in an open area, where there are no obstacles to the sun's rays._x000D_
Hunter Solar Panel Kit (SPNODE)_x000D_
Hunter Solar Panel Kit (SPNODE) - new accessory for battery-powered Node and XC Hybrid controllers._x000D_
Once connected, the SPNODE panel will supply the control panel with 100% of the energy it needs by accumulating solar energy. There will be no need to use batteries._x000D_
Principle of operation_x000D_
The sun's rays, falling on the surface of the panel, more precisely between the layers of the semiconductor used, contribute to the emergence of valve photo-EMF. As a result, a potential difference is formed, that is, an electric current is formed, which flows to the consumer._x000D_
Important! If the photocell (plate) is damaged, it is not recommended to repair it yourself - you need to contact a specialist, which will eliminate the problem._x000D_
The panel is an eco-innovative alternative to conventional power sources, is more ecological and guarantees trouble-free operation, while requiring no maintenance, using solar energy to power the controller 24/7 for years, even in overcast weather. ._x000D_
In the kit, the Hunter SPNODE solar panel includes all the necessary components for its fastening and connection._x000D_
After connecting the panel to the network, it may take some time to recharge the controller. It shouldn't take long at all. The advantage of using this device is that you will not need to _x000D_
Note that the Hunter SPNODE solar panel can be connected directly to the consumer ( electronic control unit), and to the battery, which will accumulate the charge. This function is a big plus of the proposed products._x000D_
 The advantages of the Hunter SPNODE solar battery_x000D_
 Its features include the following:_x000D_
 1. The ability not to worry about the power supply of the ECU;_x000D_
 2. High manufacturing quality;_x000D_
 3. Completely safe for surrounding people;_x000D_
 4. The manufacturer provides an operational guarantee - 5 years;_x000D_
 5. Simple connection and installation - just choose the most suitable place;_x000D_
 Note that the use of this Hunter SPNODE solar panel fully automates the irrigation system - there is no need to worry about constant power supply, i.e. to the panel will fully provide power for the electronic control unit and the remotes of the Node and XCH series._x000D_
 Council. Before buying this device, we recommend that you have accurate information about the total power consumption of the automatic irrigation system. For example, several Hunter SPNODE solar panels may be required._x000D_
 Principle of operation_x000D_
 The sun's rays, having reached the surface of the panel, more precisely between the layers of the used semiconductor, contribute to the emergence of valve photo-EMF. As a result, a potential difference is formed, that is, an electric current is formed, which reaches the consumer._x000D_
 Important! If the photocell (plate) is damaged, it is not recommended to repair it yourself - you need to contact a specialist who will fix the problem._x000D_
 It should be noted that the small and compact dimensions of the panel allow you to install it anywhere - it is enough to take care of the free space around it (it is not desirable to have large structures, trees that can prevent the sun's rays from entering)._x000D_
 >
Name: Hunter Spnode solar panel

Sime Synkro sectoral and circular irrigation water cannon 25°. sprinkler machines - drum and circular. And it can also be used for mobile and stationary installations._x000D_
The adjustable jet interrupter, which works only on the return, allows you to achieve a uniform distribution of precipitation over the entire irrigated area._x000D_
Its work, based on based on a completely new concept, prevents any vibrations and counter-shocks, ensuring absolute safety for the user, and also allows it to be used on very steep slopes._x000D_

Impulse_x000D_

adjustable jet interrupter to change the shape of the jet and quick-change nozzle adjustment_x000D_
standard tubular 2 1/2" thread_x000D_
Applications_x000D_
The SYNKRO sprinkler is an impact sprinkler. The energy of the flowing water pushes the pendulum (oscillator), which, under the action of the spring, returns to its original position and hits the rear part of the plastic switch on the jet pipe. This is how the sprinkler rotates. The sprinkler rotates when it reaches the right pivot point, which is determined by the rings on the sprinkler base. The switch clicks automatically and the pendulum swings the other way, which now hits the plastic switch blocking it on the opposite side. The sprinkler moves at the same speed in both directions. Setting the spray angle with the help of movable rings on the base. Together with the movement of the pendulum, the diffuser interacts, which, when the sprinkler turns, sinks into the stream of water, shortening the radius and dispersing._x000D_
The lower base is made of brass, the inner rotating sleeve is made of stainless steel. The body of the sprinkler, the jet tube and the pendulum are made of light aluminum alloys. Impulsive_x000D_

adjustable jet interrupter to change the shape of the jet and quick-change adjustment nozzle_x000D_
standard 3" pipe thread_x000D_
Application_x000D_
The RANGER sprayer is an impact sprayer. The energy of the flowing water pushes the pendulum (oscillator), which under the action of the spring returns to its original position and hits the back of the plastic switch on the jet pipe. This is how the sprinkler rotates. The sprinkler rotates when it reaches the right pivot point, which is determined by the rings on the sprinkler base. The switch clicks automatically and the pendulum swings the other way, which now hits the plastic switch blocking it on the opposite side. The sprinkler moves at the same speed in both directions. Setting the spray angle using movable rings on the base. Together with the movement of the pendulum, the diffuser interacts, which, when the sprinkler turns, sinks into the stream of water, shortening the radius and dispersing._x000D_
The lower base is made of brass, the inner rotating sleeve is made of stainless steel. The body of the sprinkler, the jet tube and the pendulum are made of light aluminum alloys. Nozzles made of wear-resistant plastic. Stainless steel springs. Bearing of rotary joint and pendulum. U-type rubber seal. Comes with a set of 3 replacement nozzles. The possibility of using nozzles from 18 to 36 mm. In addition, it has adjustment: dispersion and rotation speed._x000D_
The biggest advantage of a pulse sprinkler is that only one sprinkler can effectively water the entire area within its radius of action (at unlike spray and rotary sprinklers, which do not water under themselves). Impulse sprinklers for irrigation can be adjusted both in a circle and in a given sector from 20 to 360°._x000D_

Water cannon for irrigation Sime Gemini 85 sector and circular 25°_x000D_
High-flow sprinkler for high-pressure systems that rotates at a constant speed in a full or partial circle._x000D_
It is equipped with variable nozzles of different diameters and an adjustable jet interrupter, which allows you to get well-distributed irrigation throughout the irrigated territory._x000D_
This is an ideal sprinkler for additional irrigation and extensive cultivation._x000D_
Equipped with a gear changer that allows you to water from two speeds. High speed for more careful watering and slow speed for normal watering._x000D_
Attention! When the high speed is turned on, the sprinkler starts to rotate faster. It goes through one revolution (circle or sector) faster, but with less spillage of water. Fast speed is needed when watering small plants that need a lot of water. Or when you need water to reach the site in smaller portions in 1 revolution._x000D_
Productivity up to 269 m3/h._x000D_

 li>Model with sector and circular operation_x000D_

Application_x000D_
The Mariner gear sprinkler is made of quality materials by Sime Irrigation, a company located in Northern Italy, who have been creating this unique sprinkler for years. The Mariner is an excellent alternative to impact sprinklers when smooth and gentle operation without impact vibration is required._x000D_
The sprinkler has a female pipe thread connection, an adjustable jet interrupter and provides wide coverage._x000D_
Gear driven sprinklers operate smoothly, are gentle on delicate crops and can operate at lower pressures than many large sprinklers. Continuous rotation, low reverse speed and uniform water flow make them an ideal choice for installation on stationary gun stands, mobile sprinklers, center circles, etc._x000D_
No tools are needed to change the operation from partial circle to full circle; nozzles are manually changed._x000D_
The Mariner gear sprinkler is a powerful sprayer and an excellent choice for many applications, including agriculture, mining dust control, change sprinkler for mobile irrigation machines and many others. etc._x000D_

Series 75 is the smallest member of the family of Big Gun® sprinklers. The sprinklers in this series are perfect for installation in stationary irrigation systems, circular sprinklers with end sprinklers, or any other situation where a long spray distance is required with limited flow and/or pressure._x000D_
severities_x000D_
The Nelson Big Gun® Series 75 sprinkler is available as a circular or sector sprinkler with various trajectories and connections. The replaceable nozzle with a conical ring makes it much easier to adjust the flow rate. Although it is the smallest sprinkler in the Big Gun® family, it uses the same reinforced bottom bearing and protected construction of the larger sprinklers. In addition, it can be used together with the QC100 to organize a mobile quick-disconnect system._x000D_
Precision Engineering_x000D_
Nelson Big Gun® sprinklers are recognized worldwide for quality, performance and technical support in the high volume irrigation industry . They are designed and manufactured using precision technologies for reliable and long-lasting operation in harsh conditions._x000D_
Each Nelson Big Gun® water cannon is subjected to the harshest to industry standards of inspection testing and quality control, including individual water testing of each sprinkler at the factory._x000D_
The first Big Gun® sprinklers were placed on the end segments of circular sprinklers over 45 years ago as a cost-effective way to engage corner areas of rainwater installation Today, the Big Gun® remains the standard among ultimate water cannons, trusted for many years of service._x000D_
Applications_x000D_
Big Gun® Vodomites are available for various fields of application with a wide range of pressure and flow values. Different irrigation trajectories, types of connections and ordering of equipment allow you to choose the ideal solution for any field of application._x000D_

The XLR water gun perfectly combines all the advantages of the previous SR3003 and SR2005 models. A workhorse for irrigation with mobile hose reels, stationary irrigation systems and for applications in industry._x000D_
Trajectory angles: 21°/24°/27°/43°_x000D_
Connection: flanged/threaded adapters_x000D_

SERIES 150_x000D_
Watering radius: 36-73 m._x000D_

Possibilities_x000D_
Sprayers of the 150 series are equipped with nozzles of increased size, which allow you to place sprinklers farther from each other on industrial facilities and in stationary irrigation systems, as well as increase the width of the spans for mobile coils._x000D_
The 150 series is represented by the widest range of options and accessories in the industry. Circular or sector irrigation models, different trajectories (including a model with an adjustable trajectory), three different types of nozzles, special coatings and models for waste water - we offer a unique solution for any situation._x000D_
Precision Design_x000D_
Nelson Big Gun® sprinklers are recognized worldwide for quality, performance and technical support in the field of high volume irrigation. They are designed and manufactured using precision technologies for reliable and long-lasting operation in harsh conditions._x000D_
Each Nelson Big Gun® water cannon is subjected to the harshest to industry standards of inspection testing and quality control, including individual water testing of each sprinkler at the factory._x000D_
The first Big Gun® sprinklers were placed on the end segments of circular sprinklers over 45 years ago as a cost-effective way to engage corner areas of rainwater installation Today, the Big Gun® remains the standard among ultimate water cannons, trusted for many years of service._x000D_
Applications_x000D_
Big Gun® Vodomites are available for various fields of application with a wide range of pressure and flow values. Different irrigation trajectories, types of connections and ordering of equipment allow you to choose the ideal solution for any field of application._x000D_
Stationary installation for watering corn, pastures_x000D_

Use of waste water_x000D_
Dust suppression in the mining industry_x000D_
For sports fields_x000D_

Bit Performance_x000D_
Radius values are based on trajectory 24 for the 75, 100 and 150 series, and trajectory 27 for the 200 series. At smaller values of the trajectory angles, wind erosion is reduced, but spray distances are shortened._x000D_
 The reduction of the spraying distance depends on the nozzle consumption. As a general rule, the spray distance is reduced by about 3% for every 3° decrease in the trajectory angle. The use of a wedge insert to change the trajectory will affect the jet range._x000D_
Big Gun® performance data is obtained under ideal test conditions, so actual data may be affected by faulty hydraulic input conditions and other factors._x000D_
The test lift height is 0.91 m above the measuring surface. No assurances are made as to droplet condition, uniformity, application rates, or suitability for a particular application. Pressure values are for the nozzle._x000D_
Mounting_x000D_
Mobile and stationary system_x000D_
Big Gun® sprinklers have been used for decades for permanent, stationary and mobile irrigation in difficult or labor-intensive areas. The combined use of Nelson distribution valves and TWIG® wireless controls opens up a completely new level in the field of irrigation and allows you to create perfect irrigation systems with Big Gun® sprinklers._x000D_
Circular Sprinkler End Sprinkler_x000D_
The first Big Gun® sprinklers were placed on the end segments of circular sprinklers over 45 years ago as a cost-effective way to engage the corner areas of the sprinkler. Today, the Big Gun® remains the standard among ultimate water cannons, trusted for many years of service._x000D_
Moving Reel with Coiled Hose_x000D_
Big Series The Gun® complements this efficient irrigation system with its reliability, long life and easy maintenance. The trajectory angle of 21° provides an optimal combination of spraying distance and wind resistance; for calm weather conditions, options with a trajectory angle of 24° are available._x000D_

Section: Automatic watering equipment / Watering timers / Eve Aqua watering timers
Unnamed: 2:
Eve Aqua Smart Water Controller Apple Homekit_x000D_
Eve Aqua is great hardware with software that takes ease of use to the next level. This multi-functional solution is easy to install and makes it easy to connect your home irrigation system with HomeKit._x000D_
The smart water controller securely attaches to an outdoor faucet, and thanks to the accessory's standard 26.5mm/G ¾" thread, you can easily connect conventional hoses and other popular hose systems (such as Gardena or K&rcher) with the included hose._x000D_
Autonomous schedules_x000D_
7 watering periods/day_x000D_
No bridge and sluice_x000D_
Compatible with all popular hose systems_x000D_
Bluetooth and flow_x000D_
High data privacy_x000D_
Eve Aqua has a single built-in button that starts or stops the water flow with a single touch Tap once and the valve will open. Eve Aqua will automatically turn off the water supply after a set time that you can set in the Eve app - a really easy way to water your lawn without wasting precious water. Eve Aqua is also equipped with HomeKit technology and enough memory to store complex schedules. This means you can start watering from your iPhone or Siri, and if you have a home hub, you can even do it while on vacation. You can also take it a step further and use Eve to add schedules that are then stored in Eve Aqua for a fully automated irrigation system._x000D_
The latest generation Eve Aqua supports Bluetooth and Thread and automatically connects to your Thread networks. Thread makes your smart home network more responsive, reliable, and extends its reach—all you need is the HomePod mini. You can even add Thread support to the latest generation Eve Aqua by simply updating the accessory's firmware._x000D_
Flow control_x000D_
Using a schedule_x000D_
A schedule starts regular watering of the garden in at the time and for the period you specify. Because schedules are stored directly in Eve Aqua, they can be run at any time—whether Eve Aqua is connected to your iPhone or the Internet, all without a bridge or gateway._x000D_
Via iPhone, Siri or directly on the device_x000D_
You can water at any time with one push of a button on board. But it is even more convenient to control Eve Aqua from iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch and with the help of Siri._x000D_
Stopping schedule_x000D_
On vacation you saw in the summary weather that the heat is about to set in at home. Not a problem. With your home hub — HomePod, HomePod mini, or Apple TV — you can stay connected and easily water your garden on the go. If the weather turns out to be better than forecast, you can stop the schedule whenever you want, wherever you are._x000D_
Auto shut offWater losses and floods due to forgetfulness are a thing of the past. After you've manually started watering, Eve Aqua automatically shuts off the water again after a time you specify once - reliably, quickly and silently thanks to the magnetic valve._x000D_
How much water is your garden using? The Eve program constantly calculates the amount of watering.;_x000D_
Eve Aqua can be controlled via the Eve app, Home and Siri_x000D_
 Installation_x000D_
You can install Eve Aqua on almost any outdoor faucet. Just make sure you screw the accessory all the way onto the faucet with your fingers and that it's securely attached to prevent leaks._x000D_
To insert or replace the batteries, press gently with your thumbs on the ridged surface at the bottom of the Eve Aqua and then slide the lid forward. The tape makes it easy to remove the batteries - just wrap it around them and fully insert them into the compartment before closing the cover. Leaving it hanging outside can cause moisture to enter the case and battery compartment._x000D_
At the end of the gardening season, protect Eve Aqua from frost, like most loose irrigation devices, to avoid damage to moving parts, seals, and fasteners. It is best to unscrew the Eve Aqua from the tap, clean the accessory, open the valve, remove the batteries and allow everything to dry thoroughly before putting it away for the winter._x000D_
Thanks to the standard thread, hose connection and the ability to withstand a wide range of pressures of water (1 bar/14.5 psi to 5 bar/72.5 psi) Eve Aqua is ideal for use with all conventional irrigation systems. You can also connect it to a 2-prong jack, among other types of multi-channel splitters. With this setup, Eve Aqua is always supplied with water, leaving you with one outlet to connect a conventional hose. The possibilities are truly endless._x000D_
Eve Aqua is compatible with all popular hose systems and multi-channel water dispensers such as Gardena or K&aucher and can be installed in minutes. It's also ideal for more complex watering tasks, as Eve allows you to set up to seven individual daily watering periods for each day._x000D_
Even if you only go on weekends , flowers in pots or vegetables in raised beds still require regular watering. Prevent them from wilting by solving this problem quickly and economically with Eve Aqua and the Gardena micro-drip irrigation system._x000D_
Thanks to the two-channel water distributor you can use Eve Aqua for watering without turning off the faucet. and you won't need to take Eve Aqua off when you just need to fill the kiddie pool or wash your hands._x000D_
Technical requirementsiPhone or iPad with the latest version of iOS/iPadOS_x000D_
HomePod or Apple TV (4th generation or later) is required as a home hub to automatically control this HomeKit-enabled accessory away from home_x000D_

Pressure: 1 bar - 5 bar_x000D_
IPX4 waterproof_x000D_

Charging: 2 replaceable AA batteries_x000D_

Dimensions: 77x95x128 mm_x000D_

For correct and trouble-free operation, install the timer vertically along the input/output axis._x000D_
The power supply is provided by two AAA batteries (not included), the charge of one set is enough for a period of up to 3 months. The product is not frost-resistant, so it must be dismantled for the winter period. The timer housing is made of high-quality plastic, durable, resistant to ultraviolet rays. To extend the service life of the product, it is recommended to use a coarse filter in the water supply system._x000D_
Please note! Not intended for industrial use with solutions of chemically active and flammable liquids, food products._x000D_

Disable and manual launch modes are provided for immediate program bypass if necessary watering The large screen of the timer allows you to see all the selected settings at the same time. During operation, the screen displays the status of the program, namely the next scheduled cycle and the remaining operating time in the current cycle. There is also a rain delay mode for up to 96 hours, which does not affect the saved program. Allows you to adjust the watering time from 1 to 360 minutes. The watering interval is set every day of the week by the start time. A maximum of two irrigation sessions can be set per day._x000D_
Equipped with a reliable ball valve mechanism that allows the timer to work even from a water container without a pump. Working pressure 0.5-6 bar. The maximum water consumption is 2.2 m3/h. The permissible water temperature is from 4 to 60 degrees. The timer housing is water resistant, but not waterproof. Close the rear protective cover tightly to prevent water from entering the product. The timer installation process does not take much time and does not require an additional tool. For correct and smooth operation, set the timer vertically along the input/output axis._x000D_
Power supply is provided by two AA batteries (not included in the kit), the charge of one kit is enough for up to 3 months The timer housing is made of high-quality plastic, durable, resistant to ultraviolet rays. To extend the service life of the product, it is recommended to use a coarse filter in the water supply system._x000D_
Please note! Not intended for industrial use with solutions of chemically active and flammable liquids, food products._x000D_

 Features:_x000D_

 • How to use the delay button:_x000D_
 For example, if it is 10:00, you set the frequency to 1 hour and the running time to 5 minutes, this means that the first watering will start at 11:00 and will be carried out for 5 minutes (the second watering starts at 12:00). But if you want the first watering to start at 12:00, you need to use the delay button. You can press the button and hold it for more than 2 seconds until the light turns on, then press the time delay button once, the start of watering will be postponed only one hour later, so in this case you press the delay button twice - watering will take place after two hours , so the first watering will start at 12:00._x000D_

Rain Bird RWS-BGX Root Irrigation System with with a pre-installed Rain Bird 1401 Series baler_x000D_
A root irrigation system - there's nothing better for keeping trees healthy. RWS-M-BG: Root Irrigation System with pre-installed Rain Bird Series 1401 bubbler, lockable grates, ½” SPX-Flex pipe swivel connector._x000D_
Application_x000D_
System root irrigation RWS is an advanced system for underground installation, designed specifically for watering trees and shrubs._x000D_
Allows vital water, air and nutrients to reach the plant's root system in areas with compacted soil or thick turf._x000D_
Used only with a bubbler._x000D_
Functionality_x000D_
3-year warranty_x000D_
Patented wicker basket._x000D_
Promotes the growth of trees and shrubs by allowing nutrients to directly reach the plant's root system._x000D_
Releases trapped gases that can harm the plant._x000D_
The system is ideal for urban facilities: underground irrigation helps to prevent the roots from reaching the surface._x000D_
Grates protect the system from vandalism._x000D_
Connects to an underground pipeline._x000D_
Time saving: the system is delivered ready to install with the Rain Bird 1401 self-compensating baler installed._x000D_
Aesthetically pleasing, because it is installed underground and does not spoil the landscape._x000D_
Easy installation: one, instead of many elements._x000D_
Reliable: all elements are selected and assembled at the factory._x000D_
Top bars protect the system._x000D_
A grid with thousands of holes allows water and air to penetrate directly to the roots._x000D_
Technical characteristics_x000D_
The body and closing bars are made of UV-resistant reinforced polymer. Top grills protect the internal structure: bubbler and fittings._x000D_
No adjustment required_x000D_
Pre-Bubbler Rain Bird 1401_x000D_
Compensates pressure from 1.5 to 5.5 bar ._x000D_
Consumption: 57 l/h._x000D_
Installation_x000D_
Irrigation of large trees Rain Bird RWS is well suited for underground irrigation in urban conditions, because if the necessary moisture is present in the soil, the tree will not send its roots to the surface. It can be used successfully for private properties._x000D_
The system is installed underground and connected to the underground pipeline, so it is not easy to notice and break._x000D_
The principle of its operation is that moisture and air seep to the roots through a lattice with many holes._x000D_
Also, its use does not spoil the aesthetics of the landscape and lawn._x000D_

Section: Self-Watering Equipment / Underground Root Irrigation System / Hunter Underground Root Irrigation System
Unnamed: 2:
Hunter RZWS-18 Root Watering System_x000D_
For the successful growth of young plants and trees, it is necessary to ensure adequate irrigation and a constant supply of oxygen at all levels of the root zone. This stimulates the roots to grow deep and prevents them from "creeping" to the surface, allowing the plants to be strong and well established in the ground._x000D_
The root irrigation system, equipped with Hunter's patented design solution - StrataRoot™, which is a series of in-soil diffusers that direct water, oxygen and nutrients to the root zone and ensure the strength of the irrigation cylinder design._x000D_
RZWS comes in pre-assembled for easy installation, and the closed design and protective grills prevent intentional damage to the irrigation equipment._x000D_
Hunter RZWS is the optimal solution for efficient irrigation of the entire root zone of trees and shrubs._x000D_
Benefits_x000D_
Built-in flexible Hunter elbow for direct connection with 1/2" PVC fittingsHunter pressure-compensated bubbler for precise water delivery_x000D_
Watering system delivered ready-made_x000D_
Patented StrataRoot™ diffusers to deliver water to the roots and increase irrigation efficiencyAnti-vandal cover_x000D_
Technical characteristics_x000D_
Bubbler consumption: 0.9 or 1.9 l/min_x000D_
Recommended working pressure: 1.0-4.8 bar; 100-480 kPa_x000D_
Size: 25, 45, 90 cm._x000D_
 li>_x000D_
Installation_x000D_
Dig holes of the required diameter and depth, each hole should be at least 5 inches in diameter and 5 inches deep must ensure the possibility of installing the RZWS module flush with the ground surface. To set the RZWS module to a depth it was not designed for, it can be trimmed._x000D_
Place the modules around the tree at equal intervals at a distance equal to half the width of the tree crown. The choice of RZWS module type depends on the tree's watering requirements. A minimum of two RZWS modules must be used per tree._x000D_
If RZWS models supplied without internal equipment are used, add the appropriate watering devices. Connect each module to the lateral line system._x000D_
Backfill the recesses around the RZWS modules. On sandy soils, use a filter material sleeve to prevent soil from entering the device. Hunter product number: RZWS SLEEVE._x000D_
Strictly follow recommendations for planting specific tree species based on local conditions._x000D_

Section: Self-Watering Equipment / Underground Root Irrigation System / Hunter Underground Root Irrigation System
Unnamed: 2:
Hunter RZWS-10 Root Watering System_x000D_
For the successful growth of young plants and trees, it is necessary to ensure adequate irrigation and a constant supply of oxygen at all levels of the root zone. This stimulates the roots to grow deep and prevents them from "creeping" to the surface, allowing the plants to be strong and well established in the ground._x000D_
The root irrigation system, equipped with Hunter's patented design solution - StrataRoot™, which is a series of in-soil diffusers that direct water, oxygen and nutrients to the root zone and ensure the strength of the irrigation cylinder design._x000D_
RZWS comes in pre-assembled for easy installation, and the closed design and protective grills prevent accidental damage to the irrigation equipment._x000D_
Hunter RZWS is the optimal solution for efficient irrigation of the entire root zone of trees and shrubs._x000D_
Benefits_x000D_
Built-in flexible Hunter elbow for direct connection with 1/2" PVC fittingsHunter bubbler with pressure compensation for precise water delivery_x000D_
Watering system supplied ready-made_x000D_
Patented StrataRoot™ diffusers to deliver water to the roots and increase irrigation efficiencyAnti-vandal cover_x000D_
Technical characteristics_x000D_
Bubbler consumption: 0.9 or 1.9 l/min_x000D_
Recommended working pressure: 1.0-4.8 bar; 100-480 kPa_x000D_
Size: 25, 45, 90 cm._x000D_
 li>_x000D_
Installation_x000D_
Dig holes of the required diameter and depth, each hole should be at least 5 inches in diameter and 5 inches deep must ensure the possibility of installing the RZWS module flush with the ground surface. To set the RZWS module to a depth it was not designed for, it can be trimmed._x000D_
Place the modules around the tree at equal intervals at a distance equal to half the width of the tree crown. The choice of the type of RZWS module depends on the requirements for watering the tree. A minimum of two RZWS modules must be used per tree._x000D_
If RZWS models supplied without internal equipment are used, add the appropriate watering devices. Connect each module to the lateral line system._x000D_
Backfill the recesses around the RZWS modules. On sandy soils, use a filter material sleeve to prevent soil from entering the device. Hunter product number: RZWS SLEEVE._x000D_
Strictly follow recommendations for planting specific tree species based on local conditions._x000D_
Note. Under the maintenance time of the RZWS module must use a special a tool that allows you to access the necessary components and unlock the two clips on the cover._x000D_
Name: Hunter RZWS-10 root irrigation system

Section: Drip Irrigation / Drip Tube / No Drippers / No Drippers Presto-PS
Unnamed: 2:
Drip tube blind Presto-PS for organizing systems drip irrigation_x000D_
A blind drip tube is the most versatile and inexpensive choice for creating a drip irrigation system. The main advantage of a blind drip tube, in comparison with a drip tape and a perennial tube with drippers, is the ability to organize irrigation in areas with unevenly planted plants._x000D_
To build a system based on a blind tube, it is necessary to additionally purchase garden drippers. The distance between the droppers is set arbitrarily, depending on the location of a particular plant. Droppers are installed under the root in holes prepared in advance with a hole punch._x000D_
Presto-PS blind drip tube is a PVC tube with a diameter of 16 mm and a wall thickness of 1.3 mm. The wall of the tube is solid, without holes and built-in emitters. A wide selection of fittings and drippers allows you to quickly and easily create a new irrigation system or connect to an existing one. Due to the presence of an ultraviolet filter in the tube, the influence of sunlight on it is reduced, which guarantees long-term use of 4-5 years or more._x000D_
The tube is used for draining and applying fertilizers both in open ground and in greenhouses for humidification air with the help of sprayers "Fog". In addition to the usual types of application, it is optimally suitable for watering summer cottages and outbuildings, hedges, potted flowers, gardens, vineyards, berry crops._x000D_
The drip tube is easily installed in a short time and with minimal labor costs. Use only water-soluble fertilizers. Before finishing irrigation, flush the tubes to avoid sediment deposition._x000D_
Applications_x000D_
Watering crops in open ground_x000D_
Watering crops in greenhouses and greenhousesWatering seedlings in open and closed ground_x000D_
Watering decorative plants and flowers_x000D_
Home sites_x000D_
Functional features_x000D_
Simplicity of installation of the system_x000D_
Arbitrary location of droppers_x000D_
Versatile use_x000D_
Allows application of water-soluble fertilizers_x000D_
Installation_x000D_
Place the tube branches along the rows_x000D_
Lay the main pipe perpendicular to the rows_x000D_
At the beginning of the main pipe mount a filter for water purification. mesh or disk_x000D_
Connect the tube with the supply pipe using starters or taps_x000D_
Put the tube on the starter_x000D_
Drill 3 mm holes at the required distance using a hole punch_x000D_
Install droppers of the desired shape_x000D_
Muffle the end of each branch with a plug_x000D_
In case of mechanical damage blind tube use a repair joint_x000D_
Name: Drip tube without droppers Presto-PS (Blind) D16x1.3 mm - 1 meter

Drip tube perennial Irritec for organizing drip irrigation systems_x000D_
Drip tube is a device designed to supply water under pressure. Gradual distribution is carried out due to continuous work. A characteristic feature of the design is the presence of a compensation system. Its main purpose is to ensure the same flow along the entire length of the hose. The water is gradually absorbed, reaching the final goal. According to the design device, installation is carried out quickly. The natural flexibility, due to the underlying material, ensures the flexibility of the hose and resistance to breakage._x000D_
The drip tube with pressure compensation works even if there is a change in pressure. It is noteworthy that the volume of water used does not change. The use of this type of pipe is an ideal solution for areas with different heights._x000D_
Designs with pressure compensation are characterized by greater practicality. Those at the base of the dropper align the tube when supplying water. This allows you to freely use the structure in places with height differences._x000D_
Applications_x000D_
The drip tube is an affordable way to irrigate areas of any size. The device belongs to the inexpensive class. For the price, you won't find a better offer. An exception is the drip tape, but it only partially performs the functions of a drip tube._x000D_
The design is used for watering and irrigation in summer cottages, gardens, greenhouses, flower beds, vineyards, etc. There are many areas of application of the design (including agriculture), which emphasizes its versatility._x000D_

possibility use under low pressure_x000D_
reasonable price_x000D_
versatility (many areas of application)_x000D_
water savings due to automation_x000D_
long service life_x000D_

Drip tube in fleece fabric Hunter ECO-MAT_x000D_
Eco-Mat is designed for irrigation of hard-to-reach areas. It is a structure consisting of drip irrigation hoses with built-in drippers and a specialized fleece material that serves to evenly distribute moisture under the soil cover. The hoses (PLD-ESD) are covered with a fleece cover and securely fixed on the fleece fabric. Rolls of fleece material together with a drip irrigation hose are rolled out on the ground, then covered with a layer of soil, thus being located directly under the root systems of plants. The water supplied from the PLD-ESD drippers is permeated by the Eco-Mat. Eco-Mat doesn't just do subsurface irrigation, it makes it great. Since the irrigation system is located under the ground cover, it can be used in places with a large concentration of people: amusement parks, city squares, shopping center territories. At the same time, you do not need to worry about vandalism and choosing the right time period for watering, because irrigation can be carried out 24 hours a day._x000D_
Eco-Mat is also a highly effective solution for watering green roofs. When arranging a green roof, a special soil with more intensive drainage than natural soil is used. In such conditions, it is difficult to grow plants, because there is very little water in such soil. Eco-Mat provides water saturation up to 100% of the irrigation area and accumulates 2 liters of water per square meter of fleece fabric. When the Eco-Mat is saturated with water, it acts as a reservoir from which the plants consume moisture._x000D_
Applications: Underground drip irrigation_x000D_
 Consumption: 2.2 l/h_x000D_
Eco-Mat. The fleece material is made of polyethylene terephthalate (PET), which contributes to the creation of capillary effect, holding water for future use._x000D_

Drip tube with pressure compensation Eurodrip for organizing systems drip irrigation system_x000D_
Maximum flexible, twist-resistant hose with drippers for irrigation of row plantings with a pressure compensation system._x000D_
This is a dark brown drip hose that many irrigation contractors prefer to use. The drippers are equidistant from each other, each dripper has a flow rate of 2.3 liters per hour._x000D_
The drip hose comes in a bay and looks like a regular (brown) polyethylene tube. If you look closely, you will see a joint protruding from the inside of the tube at regular intervals, and a small hole about a millimeter in diameter. The joint is a pressure compensating labyrinth and the water comes out of a tiny hole._x000D_
Our Eurodrip drip line is Pressure Compensated (PC), which means that each drip emitter in the coil will deliver the exact amount of water ( 2.3 liters per hour for this model), regardless of the pressure inside the pipe or whether it is at the maximum level. at the beginning of the coil or at the far end, which can be up to 100 m away._x000D_

Designed for watering lawns, dense plantings, hedges, trees, etc._x000D_

1.2mm. High mechanical reliability and protection against fractures and breaks_x000D_

Reliability_x000D_
The design of the dripper with a pressure compensation system ensures a constant flow of water along the entire hose, which guarantees a constant pressure without taking into account slopes._x000D_
The dropper is self-cleaning. It has a floating membrane that continuously self-cleans during the operation of the irrigation system._x000D_
Easy installation_x000D_
The original material provides much greater flexibility and resistance to twisting , which allows you to lay the pipeline at sharper angles and with the use of a smaller number of corner fittings and pegs for its simple and quick fixation._x000D_

The possibility of choosing the distance between the drippers and the length of the hose provides the possibility of use for different tasks_x000D_
